intro: Bonania spinosa, commonly known as the spinous bonania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically displaying white or pale yellow petals. Bonania spinosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
